title: Textile, "Nippon Moon Landing", 1970–79
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: screen printed on plain weave
markings: On left edge: 1973 Frances Butler for Goodstuffs Handprinted Fabrics
dimensions:
Warp x Weft: 280.5 x 125 cm (9 ft. 2 7/16 in. x 49 3/16 in.)
Repeat: H: 90 cm (35.5 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase from Textile Department Fund
description: Traditionally dressed Japanese women hold an illustration of a mechanical head.  The background depicts men in space suits walking on the surface of the moon.  A rhinoceros is used to pattern one of the women's kimonos and an illustration of medieval European heralds is a pattern on another kimono. Printed in four colors: deep blue, light blue, yellow and pink.  Yellow over pink for orange.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, "Nippon Moon Landing", 1970–79.
1970–79. Medium: cotton
Technique: screen printed on plain weave. Museum purchase from Textile Department Fund. 1978-176-1.
